publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-2079 Bill Kidd: Accessible Housing—That the Parliament congratulates Inclusion Scotland on organising and holding its Homes for Life conference in Glasgow on 17 June 2008; recognises that the availability of accessible housing is of vital concern to disabled people and welcomes its efforts to bring this issue to the attention of housing associations, planners, home designers, house builders and local and national decision makers, and looks forward to a future when the adoption of best practice in planning, design and house building means that all people will be able to acquire houses suitable to their needs and to continue to live in their own homes if they acquire an impairment.
